title: Cumbernauld Colts F.C.
text:
Cumbernauld Colts Football Club is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> team from <a href="Cumbernauld">Cumbernauld</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a> which was formed in 1969.
The senior team competed in the <a href="Caledonian%20Amateur%20Football%20League">Caledonian Amateur Football League</a> with the club eventually entering the <a href="Lowland%20Football%20League">Lowland Football League</a> in 2015.
History.
Colts were formed in 1969, and had success as a youth football club in the 70s and 80s, helping develop young footballers such as future <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> internationals <a href="Derek%20Whyte">Derek Whyte</a>,<a href="Jackie%20McNamara">Jackie McNamara</a> and <a href="Dougie%20Bell">Dougie Bell</a>.
The club had a period of decline in the '90s, due to several of its teams disbanding. It was re-branded in 1999, and built its way back up.
In 2015, the club was awarded full membership of the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish FA</a> and was elected to the <a href="Lowland%20Football%20League">SLFL</a>.
Ground.
Colts currently play at the all-seated <a href="Broadwood%20Stadium">Broadwood Stadium</a>, currently ground-sharing with <a href="Scottish%20League%20One">Scottish League One</a> side <a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a>.
Current squad.
As of 28 January 2022
Season-by-season record.
Lowland League.
† Season curtailed due to coronavirus pandemic
